segments.text: what do we need to get from the supermarket ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: we need lots of things . I ’ ll make a list . We need a bag of sugar , a loaf of bread and a crate of beer .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: a crate of beer ? Why do we need that ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: just joking . I would like to get a few bottles of beer though . We also need a liter of cooking oil .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: we can buy a three-liter bottle . It works out cheaper per liter . We should buy a packet of butter and a few pints of milk too .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ d like to get a jar of strawberry jam and a bottle of tomato ketchup . Do we need any meat ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think we should get half a kilo of minced beef and a few pork chops .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: ok . Let ’ s not forget fruit and vegetables . We need a bunch of bananas , a kilo of tomatoes and a bag of potatoes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: we should also get a tube of toothpaste and a bar of soap . Let ’ s get a tub of ice cream too . We can treat ourselves .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: ok . We should get a few tins of tuna . Anything else ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ d like a few cans of coke . We also need a dozen eggs and half a dozen sausages .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: let ’ s get a chunk of cheese too . Is that everything .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think so . I ’ Ve got the shopping list , so let ’ s go .
segments.speaker: S1
